methods_proposed.description: Use most recent production value as forecast

methods_proposed.name: Linear Trend Forecast
methods_proposed.description: Fit linear regression on historical production trends
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_linear_trend(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
    # Use historical trend and area features
    features = ['prod_trend', 'Area-2023-24', 'Yield-2022-23']
    X_train = train_df[features]
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    model = LinearRegression().fit(X_train, y_train)
    X_test = test_df[features]
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)

methods_proposed.name: Random Forest Regressor
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_random_forest(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
    # Use all available features
    features = [c for c in train_df.columns if c != target_col and c != 'Crop']
    X_train = train_df[features]
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42).fit(X_train, y_train)
    X_test = test_df[features]
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
